workflow.name: Benchmark content safety guardrails with automated test suite & reports
workflow.description:
## üõ°Ô∏è Evaluate Guardrails Node Accuracy with Automated Test Suite

This workflow benchmarks the **n8n Guardrails node** across multiple safety categories -including PII, NSFW, jailbreak attempts, secret keys, and unsafe URLs.  
It runs **36 structured test cases**, classifies each as PASS or VIOLATION, calculates accuracy metrics, and emails a detailed HTML report.


### üîÑ How it works
1. The workflow loops through 36 predefined test prompts.  
2. Each prompt is checked by the **Guardrails node** for violations.  
3. Results are recorded as PASS or VIOLATION.  
4. The system calculates metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1).  
5. A formatted Markdown ‚Üí HTML report is generated and sent via Gmail.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Set up steps
1. Add your **OpenAI** and **Gmail** credentials in n8n.  
2. Replace `YOUR_MAIL_HERE` in the Gmail node with your own address.  
3. *(Optional)* Change the model in the **OpenAI Chat Model** node.  
   - Default: `gpt-4o-mini`  
   - You can switch to `gpt-5` or another available model if needed.  
4. Click **Execute Workflow**: test cases will run automatically.  
5. Check your inbox for the results.

### üß† Who it‚Äôs for
- AI safety testers and workflow developers  
- n8n users experimenting with the Guardrails node  
- Teams validating LLM moderation, filtering, or compliance setups

### üß© Requirements
- n8n **v1.119+**  
- Guardrails node enabled  
- OpenAI credentials (optional but recommended)  
- Email integration (Gmail or SendGrid)


## üí° Why it‚Äôs useful
Use this test suite to understand how accurately the Guardrails node identifies unsafe content across different categories. The generated metrics help you fine-tune thresholds, compare models, and strengthen AI moderation workflows.

### Example result
![image.png](fileId:3279)
![image.png](fileId:3280)

parameters.content:
## üõ°Ô∏è Guardrails Evaluation Workflow  
This workflow automatically tests the n8n **Guardrails node** against 36 curated prompts covering Jailbreak, NSFW, PII, Keywords, URLs, and Secret Keys.  
It benchmarks how well your Guardrails configuration detects unsafe content.

### üîç Why this workflow is useful
- Ensures your AI automation complies with safety policies  
- Helps you evaluate different LLMs or threshold settings  
- Generates a complete precision/recall/F1 score report  

### üîÑ What the workflow does
1. Generates 36 synthetic safety test cases  
2. Sends them through the Guardrails node  
3. Classifies each result as PASS or VIOLATION  
4. Builds a full confusion matrix and category analysis  
5. Produces a Markdown + HTML report  
6. Sends the report to your email inbox  

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup
- Add OpenAI credentials  
- Add Gmail credentials  
- Replace `YOUR_MAIL_HERE` with your email  
- Click **Execute Workflow**

### üß© Customization
- Add more test cases in **Set Test Data**  
- Adjust guardrail thresholds in **Check Guardrails**  
- Swap Gmail for Slack/Teams/HTTP API

### üéØ Ideal for
AI workflow builders, LLM safety engineers, template creators, QA teams.

### üß† Requirements
- n8n ‚â• **1.119**  
- Guardrails node enabled  
- OpenAI credentials (optional for LLM reference)  
- Gmail or SendGrid account (optional)

## üìù Test Case Generator  
Creates 36 pre-defined prompts covering all safety categories.  
You can extend or modify these cases to test specific guardrail behaviours.

**Why it matters:**  
A consistent test suite ensures reproducible Guardrails evaluation and avoids random results.

## üîÅ Loop Through Each Test Case  
Iterates through the 36 prompts so Guardrails can evaluate them one by one.  
This ensures each test is processed cleanly and results can be matched to the correct test case.

## üì¶ Preserve Original Metadata  
Stores the test case‚Äôs ID, expected result, category, and description at the top level.  
This is needed because Guardrails replaces the JSON structure ‚Äî this step keeps original labels intact.

## üõ°Ô∏è Guardrails Evaluation  
Applies safety filters to the input text (NSFW, jailbreak, keywords, URLs, PII, secret keys).  
Outputs triggered checks and confidence scores.

**Why this matters:**  
This is the core of the entire benchmark ‚Äî the Guardrails output determines PASS or VIOLATION.

## üßÆ Normalize Result Format  
These nodes convert Guardrails output into a unified structure:  
- expected  
- actual  
- correct (boolean)  
- score  
- violation type  
- timestamp  

This creates consistent evaluation data for later metric calculations.

## üîó Merge Results  
Collects PASS and VIOLATION outputs and reunites them in the correct sequence before final aggregation.

## üìä Build Accuracy Metrics  
Generates:  
- Confusion matrix  
- Precision / Recall / F1 Score  
- Category-level accuracy  
- Per-item results  

This step turns raw Guardrails outputs into measurable QA data.

## üìù Build Markdown Report  
Creates a complete human-readable test report including tables, metrics, and recommendations.  
This Markdown is later converted to HTML for email delivery.

## üìÑ Convert Markdown ‚Üí HTML  
Turns the report into HTML, enabling clean formatting inside your email message.

## ‚úâÔ∏è Email Report  
Sends the formatted Guardrails report to your inbox.  
Replace **YOUR_MAIL_HERE** with your email address.
